title: krishnaverma
author: krishnaverma
content: I  have some funds in crypto that I want to spend. I am also a hobby blogger. I recently purchased my Hosting hosting with Bitcoin. What are some other good blogging related services that I can buy with Bitcoin?

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: VPS, VPN, VDS, email and domain providers, you can check this link https://bitcoin-vps.com/Remember I have not tried all of the sites, so I don't know how reputable they're, so you need to do your own diligence.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on November 12, 2023, 04:09:28 AMI  have some funds in crypto that I want to spend. I am also a hobby blogger. I recently purchased my Hosting hosting with Bitcoin. What are some other good blogging related services that I can buy with Bitcoin? Your option is limited. Blogging-related services actually do not require a lot of various things, so you are left out with hosting-related matters. Other than hosting, there are domain providers and email providers who accept Bitcoin. I think that is pretty much the only service you are able to use for a blog. Or if I am wrong, well, what kind of service that you need as a hobbyist blogger? Name it, other people may offer the alternative that accepts Bitcoin.If you'd like to spend it without necessarily having to buy services, you can donate/tip to another blogger who shows their bitcoin address.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: It's going to be pretty difficult besides blog hosting(Vultr, personally) and domain hosting(NameCheap, personally).If you're looking for things like writing services, SEO, and such, you're going to have to work peer-to-peer if you wanted to pay with bitcoin/crypto I think.

Yes but why can't you just convert it and instead turn it to USDT and have it used for whatever reasons you intend to use it for under some seconds, you are good to go. Second reason why these things may not fully play out like we want is because of the volatility that is embedded in the market. Because of that variation that is found in the ups and downs that the market face,  plenty product owners and marketers are scared of using Bitcoin as another payment option.Lack of proper and adequate awareness have also led a whole of the traders not to patronize Bitcoin as a payment option. And their fear is that of the unknown since they don't have in depth knowledge in the Bitcoin network as a whole. This has made it more important for us to create more dedicated campaigns out there to enrich people with detailed knowledge and information about the Bitcoin itself. It will go along way to open more minds to the idea behind the cryptocurrencies and especially the stablecoins.

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: Pretty much all hosting providers nowadays accept Bitcoin just the big ones like Google, Microsoft, and Aws don't accept crypto. But the small ones like VUltr Racknerd and others have started accepting crypto as payment. I paid for my Yearly hosting website using Racknerd and paid with crypto back then I used Vultr as well. and Im pay yearly VPS using crypto too Im currently using Surfshark. and all of it smooth. Nowadays you can pay with crypto in a lot of thing or if you want to spent your crypto you can start using bitcoin debit card, so you basically spend your crypto via debit.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on November 13, 2023, 10:03:59 AMLike you need 5-10 tools to monitor SEO for site. I second the opinion that you don't need that many tools to monitor SEO. I used to dabble in blogging in the past, and I recall that one tool can do many things related to SEO from keyword search to article structuring, etc. If you need 10 tools to manage your SEO, are you sure you're not using a terrible one? Even if you need to pay for their pro tier or whatever they called it, most of the time they offer more than just one thing to fulfill your needs.

comments.body: Some time ago on my local board I made a related post, it may be useful to you:Part of that original post in Spanish:Quote from: famososMuertos on August 15, 2021, 05:30:35 PMHostinger:Quote from: source1Hostinger allows you to pay with bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin and Bitcoin Cash. During the purchase completion you will be redirected to the platform page, just like when paying with PayPal.Hostwinds:Quote from: source1 accepts a wide range of cryptocurrencies using the CoinPayments platform, from well-known Bitcoin and Ethereum to lesser-known ones like Digibyte, Qtum and Dogecoin. Additionally, cryptocurrency payments are refundable as a credit to your account during the first 30 days after registration.namecheap:Quote from: source1Use cryptocurrency to fund your account – Instead of paying for services through CoinPayments and waiting for payment confirmation, use BitPay to fund your account. Payment can be made in bitcoin or Bitcoin Cash.Bitcoinwebhosting:Quote from: source1Use CoinPayments to pay the bill – After purchasing a hosting service, it will not be activated automatically; To activate it you will have to enter the invoice number and pay using the CoinPayments link. Payment can be made in bitcoin, Ethereum, Monero, Ripple and six other cryptocurrencies.Shinjiru:Quote from: source1Pay with CoinPayments – Use the platform to pay with bitcoin and Ethereum or manually transfer bitcoin to the company's bitcoin wallet. There you have the names, that's enough, the rest is done by GS.On the other hand, there are crypto domain extensions.QuoteCrypto domain providers such as Unstoppable Domains, allow us to easily attach an address like this: [0xd7c302fc3ac829c7e896a32c4bd126f3e8bd0a1f] to human-readable addresses like these: B2M .crypto / .nft / .wallet / .bitcoin / .dao / .coin.Source:https://blog.bit2me.com/en/crypto-domains/disclaimer. comments.author: Kuntus
comments.body: Many blogging-related services accept Bitcoin. Here are a few you might consider: Web Hosting: Services like Namecheap, Hostinger, and Hostwinds often accept Bitcoin for domain registration and web hosting. VPN Services:  Enhance security with VPN services like NordVPN or ExpressVPN, both of which may accept Bitcoin. Domain Registration: Some domain registrars, like Namecheap, allow you to register and renew domains using Bitcoin. Always check with the specific service provider to confirm their current payment options, as these can change over time.
